solution_line_template: The bulk warehouse has {warehouse_total_cans} cans for ${warehouse_total_dollars} so that's {warehouse_total_dollars}/{warehouse_total_cans} = ${warehouse_price_per_can} a can
The local grocery store has {grocery_total_cans} cans for ${grocery_total_dollars} so that's {grocery_total_dollars}/{grocery_total_cans} = ${grocery_price_per_can} a can

The grocery store offer is ${grocery_price_per_can} a can and the warehouse is ${warehouse_price_per_can} a can so the grocery store is {grocery_price_per_can}-{warehouse_price_per_can} = $<<{grocery_price_per_can}-{warehouse_price_per_can}={price_difference_dollars}>>{price_difference_dollars} more expensive per can
